	<item>
		<title>MicroBizMatters Day &amp; Enterprise Rocks</title>
		<link>http://www.chrispercival.co.uk/microbizmatters-day-enterprise-rocks/</link>
		<pubDate>Wed, 17 Feb 2016 09:12:17 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[chris]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.chrispercival.co.uk/?p=843</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[Late last year I was honoured to be invited to be a participant in an annual event called MicroBizMattersDay. In a nutshell, MicroBizMattersDay is a global, annual day of actions. Everyone is asked to give at least 8 minutes, day or night, to make life better for micro enterprise (0-9 employees) owners everywhere.

<strong>Why I Support #MicroBizMattersDay...</strong>

I was very excited to be supporting #MicroBizMattersDay and it’s a cause that I am particularly passionate about. Having been introduced to Tony at an awards ceremony in 2014 I have closely followed Tony and Tina and #MicroBizMatters, and how it highlights the contribution independent business owners and self-employed people make, not only to the growth of this country’s economy but to the global economy.

Additionally, startups such as the company I own, Jigsaw Medical, contribute not only to the local economy by providing jobs and security for staff, we also provide a fantastic service to the general public through the provision of highly skilled staff and brand new, state-of-the-art equipment and ambulances.
<blockquote>
<p style="text-align: center;">Tony and Tina do a fantastic job advocating the importance of the small business and startups, again something that particularly resonates with myself.</p>
</blockquote>
When I launched my business back in 2012 I was lucky enough to have a lot of help and support from experienced people as well as some fantastic family and friends. But not everyone is lucky enough to have that, so as a result, I can’t wait for January 8th where hopefully I can impart some nuggets of wisdom and advice to other micro-businesses, whilst also gaining crucial advice and tips on different things I can do to help me run my businesses.

<strong>The Day</strong>

On the day, I took part in an hour-long webchat with other entrepreneurs and microbiz owners during the Enterprising Young People Hour and found the whole experience fantastic. Being able to impart some wisdom and pick up some tips for myself was exceptionally useful.

Check out the video of the web chat. I’m on from 1 hour 52 minutes if that’s what takes your fancy! (I'm sure it isnt...)

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=cPHyztZLi-k

Overall it was a great day to be a part of and I hope to be involved next year.]]></content:encoded>

	</item>
	<item>
		<title>Jigsaw Sponsors The Virgin STRIVE Challenge 2016</title>
		<link>http://www.chrispercival.co.uk/supporting-virgin-strive-challenge/</link>
		<pubDate>Tue, 08 Mar 2016 18:44:32 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[chris]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.chrispercival.co.uk/?p=849</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<strong>After providing medical support to the Virgin STRIVE Challenge in 2014, I am delighted that we have gone one step further for 2016 and will be one of the key sponsors of this year’s <a href="http://bigchange.strivechallenge.com">Virgin STRIVE Challenge</a>. </strong>

For those that don’t know about the challenge, it was set up in 2014 by Sam Branson and cousin Noah Devereux and involves a team of people testing themselves via a series of ultra-endurance challenges, all to raise funds for the charity, <a href="http://big-change.org">Big Change</a> which was founded in 2012 by Holly and Sam Branson, Princess Beatrice of York, Sam Richardson, Phil Nevin, and Isabella Branson. It's goal - to think differently about the role that charity can play in driving change for young people in the UK. The charity aims to do more than just treating symptoms, they wanted to positively move things forward, backing solutions that demonstrate alternative ways of supporting young people- helping them to thrive in life, not just in exams.

<a href="https://www.jigsawmedical.com/wp-content/uploads/MG_7716.jpg"><img class="wp-image-6125 aligncenter" src="https://www.jigsawmedical.com/wp-content/uploads/MG_7716.jpg" alt="virgin-strive-bigchange-2016" width="800" height="533" /></a>

In 2014, we provided the ambulances, medical staff, and equipment, whilst a 10-strong team hiked, ran, rowed, cycled climbed from London to the summit of the Matterhorn in Switzerland. The 2016 challenge picks up where the 2014 challenge ended and sees a team of 25 tackle a punishing 30-day journey from the base of the Matterhorn to Mount Etna in Sicily, all whilst being looked after by #TeamJigsaw’s expert team of Doctors, Paramedics, Ambulances and Physiotherapists.

I am so proud to see Jigsaw supporting this amazing charity!]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Never Let What You Want, Oveshaddow What You Have</title>
		<link>http://www.chrispercival.co.uk/never-let-want-oveshaddow/</link>
		<pubDate>Sun, 14 Aug 2016 13:59:35 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[chris]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.chrispercival.co.uk/?p=863</guid>
		<description></description>

	</item>
	<item>
		<title>Turn your can&#039;ts into cans...</title>
		<link>http://www.chrispercival.co.uk/turn-cants-cans/</link>
		<pubDate>Tue, 16 Aug 2016 09:02:37 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[chris]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.chrispercival.co.uk/?p=867</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<h2>This morning I shared a quote on social media which I stumbled across on the internet. The author is unknown, but the words absolutely hit the nail on the head...</h2>
<a href="http://www.chrispercival.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2016/08/IMG_5802.jpg"><img class="alignright wp-image-868 size-medium" src="http://www.chrispercival.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2016/08/IMG_5802-300x225.jpg" alt="IMG_5802" width="300" height="225" /></a>

In the midst of a huge time for Jigsaw, with the upcoming launch of our new Non-Emergency Patient Transport division and some exciting new developments in all of our existing divisions, we are certainly turning our dreams, into plans.

A quote on my current office wall (I say current, as we've outgrown our current head office and are planning a move! - but more on that soon) says; "if you can dream it, you can do it" - Walt Disney. I look at this every day and it reminds me that "can't" just means either nobody has said yes yet, or nobody has done it before!

This quote is also very apt as in a couple of weeks time, I fly out to Zermatt in Switzerland to see of the <a href="http://bigchange.strivechallenge.com">Virgin STRIVE Challenge</a> team - they will certainly need to turn their can'ts into cans!

Happy Tuesday!]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>
		<wp:post_id>867</wp:post_id>
		<wp:post_date><![CDATA[2016-08-16 09:02:37]]></wp:post_date>
		<wp:post_date_gmt><![CDATA[2016-08-16 09:02:37]]></wp:post_date_gmt>
		<wp:comment_status><![CDATA[closed]]></wp:comment_status>
		<wp:ping_status><![CDATA[closed]]></wp:ping_status>
		<wp:post_name><![CDATA[turn-cants-cans]]></wp:post_name>
		<wp:status><![CDATA[publish]]></wp:status>
		<wp:post_parent>0</wp:post_parent>
		<wp:menu_order>0</wp:menu_order>
		<wp:post_type><![CDATA[post]]></wp:post_type>
		<wp:post_password><![CDATA[]]></wp:post_password>
		<wp:is_sticky>0</wp:is_sticky>
		<category domain="category" nicename="charity"><![CDATA[Charity]]></category>
		<category domain="category" nicename="thought-for-today"><![CDATA[Thought For Today]]></category>
		<wp:postmeta>
			<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[_edit_last]]></wp:meta_key>
			<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[1]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
		<wp:postmeta>
			<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[_thumbnail_id]]></wp:meta_key>

		</wp:postmeta>
		<wp:postmeta>
			<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[_wip_theme_post_layout]]></wp:meta_key>
			<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[fullwidth]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
		<wp:postmeta>
			<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[_wip_theme_sidebar_use]]></wp:meta_key>

		<wp:postmeta>
			<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[_yoast_wpseo_primary_category]]></wp:meta_key>
			<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[79]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
	</item>
	<item>
		<title>A-Level Results Day</title>
		<link>http://www.chrispercival.co.uk/level-results-day/</link>
		<pubDate>Fri, 19 Aug 2016 07:26:40 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[chris]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.chrispercival.co.uk/?p=872</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[A-Level results day is a stressful time for those who are banking on their results in order to secure competitive places on university courses. But if you've not done as well as you would have liked, the world is not over...

<a href="http://www.chrispercival.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2016/08/IMG_5625.jpg"><img class="aligncenter size-medium wp-image-873" src="http://www.chrispercival.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2016/08/IMG_5625-300x300.jpg" alt="IMG_5625" width="300" height="300" /></a>

In actual fact; Richard Branson, Deborah Meaden, Jeremy Clarkson and my good friend Lawrence Jones are examples of successful people who didn't make the grade in their A-Levels - but appear on the rich list nonetheless.

My own experience at A-Level was less than glamorous, I passed (just) and didn't manage to secure a place at University in the same year. In fact, I wasn't keen on the idea of university, but had no choice if I wanted to reach my goal of becoming a Paramedic. I battled on and managed to secure a place at Oxford Brookes University the year after, using my 'work experience' (gained during my 'year out', in place of the grades they required (as I didn't have the grades, or subjects, they asked for)... So grades are not everything.

Grades do not define you, they do not make decisions for you, they are merely an objective test of a small part of what matters in life. Since going to Oxford Brookes (with the wrong A-Levels) and graduating with Distinction, I am now extremely proud to be one of their '<a href="https://www.brookesalumni.co.uk/new-responsive-design---february-2014/responsive-pages/alumni-profiles/new-responsive-design---alumni-profiles---chris-percival">Notable Alumni</a>'!

Congratulations to those of you who have got the grades you wanted... but if you've not got the grades you wanted. Don't worry. You can do whatever you want to do, you can be whoever you want to be. A couple of exams do not define this and there are multiple routes to your goals.]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>
		<wp:post_id>872</wp:post_id>

	</item>
	<item>
		<title>#WeStrive... Together</title>
		<link>http://www.chrispercival.co.uk/westrive-together/</link>
		<pubDate>Fri, 09 Sep 2016 08:19:52 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[chris]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.chrispercival.co.uk/?p=877</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<h2>As a very proud sponsor of the Virgin STRIVE Challenge 2016, I flew to Swizerland (more specifically, Zermatt) for the launch of this amazing challenge...</h2>
Zermatt itself is an amazing place, with stunning views of the Matterhorn, where some of you may remember we ended the 2014 Challenge (with a little bit of drama, with <a href="https://www.virgin.com/richard-branson/watch-the-virgin-strive-challenge-rescue-off-the-matterhorn">Sam Branson being rescued from the summit of the Matterhorn</a>!). The 2016 challenge sets off from where the 2014 challenge finished and heads over to Sicily entirely under human power, including; hiking, cycling, swimming and finally a half-marathon up Mount Etna (you can see the full route <a href="http://bigchange.strivechallenge.com/the-route/">here</a>).

<a href="http://www.chrispercival.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2016/09/Unknown-1.jpeg"><img class="alignright size-medium wp-image-879" src="http://www.chrispercival.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2016/09/Unknown-1-300x300.jpeg" alt="unknown-1" width="300" height="300" /></a>This incredible challenge is tough for those joining it for even a stage (in total, there are 5 stages), but the core team are doing the whole thing, from start to finish! When Noah and Sam talked to the very pumped up crowd on the first evening we were in Zermatt, they made clear that STRIVEing was not about competitiveness, it was about joining forces, being a team and getting there together (in one piece!).

The amazing Karl Lokko summed it up, comparing his past where gangs were always bad things, to the Strive gang being one positive way of striving for change. One thing that really struck me throughout the first week for the challenge was just how supportive each and every striver was for their fellow team mates - it was amazing to see. One evening Richard Branson returned to one remote hut to join the rest of the team, in the dark (accompanied by one of the Jigsaw medical team and a guide) - only to be met by a standing ovation by his fellow strivers who had left the dinner table to see him back safely!! - this is what it's all about.

I am proud that Jigsaw is sponsoring such an fantastic event, for a fantastic cause, as well as providing a comprehensive ambulance, medical and physiotherapy team for the entire event.
<h3>We are all here for one reason, to raise money for Big Change - investing in Big ideas that help young people thrive in life, not just exams. To find out more or to donate to this amazing cause, please visit: <a href="http://big-change.org/">http://big-change.org/</a></h3>]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>

		<title>The iceberg of success...</title>
		<link>http://www.chrispercival.co.uk/the-iceberg-of-success/</link>
		<pubDate>Sun, 29 Jan 2017 15:38:22 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[chris]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.chrispercival.co.uk/?p=885</guid>

	</item>
	<item>
		<title>Sam Branson &amp; Noah Devereaux Visit Jigsaw House</title>
		<link>http://www.chrispercival.co.uk/growth-mindset-big-change/</link>
		<pubDate>Sun, 29 Jan 2017 15:47:40 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[chris]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.chrispercival.co.uk/?p=888</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<h1>#TeamJigsaw recently welcomed Sam Branson and Noah Devereaux to Jigsaw House to hear about STRIVING  &amp; Big Change...</h1>
<img class="alignright size-medium wp-image-891" src="http://www.chrispercival.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2017/01/15400984_10154247540328262_8689973001302486932_n-1-300x225.jpg" alt="" width="300" height="225" />

As you may have read, we were proud to have sponsored the <a href="http://bigchange.strivechallenge.com/">Virgin STRIVE Challenge</a> in 2016, raising an incredible seven-figure sum for the charity '<a href="http://big-change.org/">Big Change</a>'. As a provider of medical services and one of the key sponsors, I was pleased to welcome Sam &amp; Noah to Jigsaw House, to introduce them to the team and hear about what has been happening since the epic challenge and where the huge amount of money raised will be going.

Noah spoke to the team about 'growth mindset' and the purpose of the philosophy and we also heard from Jan (our Head of Compliance, who took part in one of the cycle legs) who although told Sam and I beforehand that she was very nervous and hated public speaking - did an incredible job (so much so, we couldn't get her off the stage - so well done Jan!). Then we heard from Kathryn, who coordinated our medical team for the STRIVE challenge, who spoke about working together as a team to look after the participants and help make the event what it was.

We had a great day hearing about the incredible cause we have all worked so far to raise such a huge amount of money for and I am very much looking forward to what Sam &amp; Noah think up for the next challenge!]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>
		<wp:post_id>888</wp:post_id>
